Many people would be surprised how much more they could achieve if they stopped worrying about getting credit. My experience is the more people give credit/information to others, the more credit they get (even though that wasn't their objective).

Strategy development/execution and investment banking (sell-side/capital raises and buy-side mandates) for digital health and medical device companies. Alira Health is an international firm providing integrated strategy, execution and innovation services for healthcare and life science companies.  Alira's roots and a continuing strength include buy-side and sell-side transaction services (investment banking) for healthcare and life sciences. Our team of consultants, bankers, doctors and scientists collaborate to fully understand every aspect of healthcare. We provide our clients with a continuum of support leading them to new levels of success at any point in their business lifecycle.
HIMSS Committee, Task Force, or Work Group Member

Serve and have served HIMSS as a leader/member of Patient Generated Health Data Task Force (member, Chair), Connected Patient Committee, Healthcare Social Media Task Force (Chair), Arizona HIMSS Board.  Co-author of 2013 HIMSS best-selling book, and author/co-author of white papers and blogs posted to the HIMSS website.

Providing digital health, telehealth and digital patient engagement strategy development and execution expertise to public and private organizations. Projects have included/include remote patient monitoring, patient privacy, consumer engagement for state HIE and state immunization registries, medication management portals for seniors, provider-based health information exchange sustainability, patient/consumer authentication, and consumer-controlled health record banking/personal health records.
Various Board Member and Advisory Positions

Board Member, Advisory Board Member, or Advisor for variety of digital healthcare and IT-related organizations, including the Arizona Telemedicine Council, am-i-ok, the Health Record Banking Alliance, eHealth Nexus, iCommand, 360 Vantage, Ubora and the Arizona HIMSS Chapter (2013-14).

Led dynamic US subsidiary of a Germany-based digital health, telehealth / telemedicine firm with 40+ employees.  Responsible for P/L, sales, marketing, US product development, and operations, which included a 24/7 medical call center.  Served on international management team.   Worked closely with hardware and software product development, and regulatory teams to launch new products internationally. We have one foot in the fee-for-service world and another in the fee-for-value/accountable care world, providing telehealth software, services, and wireless devices - the Internet of Things. Focused on turnkey mobile health and remote patient monitoring solutions in three categories:  Cardiac Event Monitoring (including Mobile Cardiac Telemetry), Population Health & Chronic Disease Management, and Medication Adherence Management.  24/7 medical call center facilitated development of innovative programs for prevention of all causes of hospital admissions/readmissions.

Eric Zilberman
Regional Marketing Manager at AMSURG
November 7, 2016, Eric reported directly to Brad

As a territory account manager at Vitaphone, I reported directly to Brad Tritle from 2013-2015. First and foremost, it truly was a pleasure to have the opportunity to learn how to operate within the healthcare industry under Brad's guidance. He possesses a rare combination of in depth industry knowledge and a comprehensive understanding of real world clinical applications. Brad has terrific empathy skills and always treats his co workers with the utmost respect. Brad uses his high capacity for problem solving and conflict resolution to foster an environment of compromise which ultimately leads to improved patient outcomes. I feel fortunate to have worked side by side with Brad and I know that under his leadership, Vitaphone will continue to thrive.

Advocate for Health/Human Services Directories
June 14, 2016, Laurie worked with Brad but at different companies

I have known Brad for a number of years and over that period have gained the greatest respect and admiration for his leadership and knowledge in the Health Information Technology (HIT), both in depth and breadth in the USA.During this time he has gained significant knowledge of the Health/Human Services Directories and how they have changed the E-Health landscape here in Australia, having followed my success over the years of the Victorian Human Services Directory to it's expansion on a national basis to become the National Services Directory (355,000 services), the National Provider Directory (300,000 accredited professional), the Telehealth Directory, the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) and much more.   He has reciprocated in kind and given me substantial knowledge of the USA Healthcare market and a number of introductions for which I am highly grateful.Brad is a born leader, futurist and can provide the vision of where products/services can fit to improve patient outcomes, sadly, I have met few others over the years.
